definition: you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Entire malls will become ghost towns.
sentences.chinese: 所有的大型商場都將變得門可羅雀。

sentences.english: Usually there are no customers during the summer, because they sell winter clothing.
sentences.chinese: 因主營冬裝，所以夏季通常門可羅雀。

sentences.english: There were few patients at another clinic where Zhang practiced as a health experts on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 張悟本週末坐診的另一家診所可謂門可羅雀。

sentences.english: He may have no shortage of party guests but he's sorely lacking in funeral attendees.
sentences.chinese: 他或許宴會從不缺嘉賓，但是葬禮就門可羅雀。

sentences.english: While Tablets are hot, connected TVs are not.
sentences.chinese: 儘管平板炙手可熱，聯網電視卻門可羅雀。

definition: to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to heave a sigh of relief
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
driver (of a taxi etc) (loanword from Japanese) (Tw)
